reviewText: Two children accidentally resurrect the fourth president of the church back to life in the form of a puppet. Hilarity ensues as traditional gender stereotypes are reinforced and physical assault on younger siblings is absolutely a laughing matter. A spectacularly racist singalong to some of your favorite primary songs back before you left the church!

Fun, nostalgic film (1990) about a puppet found by children playing in their grandma's attic, in her trunk... teaching songs (with stories) from the LDS Children's Songbook. Don't forget to check out the 2nd volume!
